Entries.default:
The prince assesses your posture and releases a calm, grateful breath. 

He unslings the hammer from his back and slowly grins.

"I will meet my death gladly if it means protecting Onekaza. You win nothing here but her vengeance." 

Gritting his teeth, Aruihi hefts his hammer and prepares to advance.

"Warriors! For Onekaza and her city, show the herald of Berath your fury!" 

Aruihi lets out a rallying cry and raises his hammer.
"I should have sent a drunken parrot to Motare o Kōzi, I say." He shakes his head and sighs.
"You can go into exile if you prefer. This doesn't need to end in bloodshed."

"I knew this day would come, but I did not guess that Tangaloa would wear your face." 

Aruihi nods and tests the weight of his weapon.
"You make your trickster mother proud, Tekēhu. Soon you can return to her embrace."
"To sell out my people and get only shame in return? This is no bargain, I say."
